comments:
I'm running Eclipse 3.0 on Fermilab Scientific Linux (Based on RH Enterprise
Linux 3.0) with the following parameters:

eclipse -vmargs -Xmx768M -Xms512M

I use the Java VM from Sun j2sdk1.4.2_04 and I have 1GB RAM.

I happens often that Eclipse crashes when trying to opening a file for editing.
 
The error reported on the .metadata/.log file is:

java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US

The "OutOfMemoryError" exception has nothing to do with the exceptions in the 
log. These exceptions are thrown when Eclipse is being closed and they have no 
effect on memory consumption.
Changing severity to normal.

The problem that caused these exceptions has been fixed in the head. I can't 
reproduce the crash. If it is still reproducible, it should be submitted as a 
separate bug to the platform.
Marking as FIXED.
